cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 30 miles south of Cape Fear, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing northeast parallel to the U.S. Mid-Atlantic coast, passing southeast of New England Friday night and then toward Nova Scotia over the weekend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Nova Scotia, Canada (as a post-tropical cyclone)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Warning in effect from the NC/VA border to Fenwick Island DE, Chesapeake Bay south of Drum Point, Tidal Potomac south of Cobb Island, and portions of southern New England
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from South Santee River SC to NC/VA border; Storm Surge Warning Cape Fear NC to Poquoson VA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Carolina coastline, Mid-Atlantic offshore waters, southeastern New England, and Atlantic Canada
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤7%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts to 30–40 mph possible Friday afternoon-evening.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Delaware River or New Jersey side associated with Dorian.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands could bring 1–2 inches of rain to the South Jersey area on Friday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along the New Jersey shore may disrupt vessel pilotage and small-craft movements.
